sen.j: この寺は、源頼朝の御家人で石清水八幡宮の社家志水氏の祖となった高田忠国が開基となり、1191年（建久2年）創建した寺と伝えられる。
sen.e: This temple is reported to have been founded in 1191 by Tadakuni TAKADA, who was an immediate vasal of the shogunate Yoritomo MINAMOTO and an ancestor of the Shimizu clan, which clan became shake (a family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) of Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine.

sen.j: なお、八幡市八幡高坊にある八角堂は現在正法寺の境外仏堂となっているが、八角堂は建保年間（1213年～1219年）石清水八幡宮の社家善法寺祐清が石清水八幡宮の境内に建立したもので、神仏分離に伴い現在地に移されたものである。
sen.e: Hakkakudo (octagon hall) located at Yawata-takabo, Yawata City, is currently an outside hall of Shobo-ji Temple, but it was originally built from 1213 to 1219 on a premise of Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine by Zenpoji Yusei, who was a member of shake (a family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) of the Iwashimizu Hachiman-gu Shrine, before being shifted to the present place in the wake of separation of Buddhism and Shintoism.
